member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.ChargeService.DefineAdvancedAutoCharges(Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.Messages.DefineAdvancedAutoChargesServiceRequest)
member.summary: Given a transaction, determine which auto charges apply, apply them, and return the resulting transaction.
member.remarks:
The charge lines added by this request will NOT have the CalculatedAmount field populated. The only job of this request is to find the charges that should be calculated and adding them to the transaction.
Manually-applied or overridden charges are preserved without change.
The three types of charges that may be applied by this service request are: 1. Transaction-level charges (i.e. cart level) 2. Line-level charges (i.e. cartline level) 3. Delivery-prorated charges (configured as header-level charges, but applied as line charges prorated across matching lines.) 3. Price charges (at the cartline level)
member.returns: The transaction with all the charges applied (but without values calculated).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.CustomerService.MergeCustomerPrimaryContacts(Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.DataModel.Customer,Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.RequestContext)
member.summary: For backward compatibility, there are 2 sources for contacts at the same time in customer entity: 1. root level customer entity properties, such as customer.Email and customer.Phone; 2. the collection of , aka customer.Contacts. Depending on the feature flag, this method will merge 2 sources and only keep one to avoid duplicate upsertion. Specifically, if feature flag is ON, customer.Contacts will be kept; otherwise, customer.Contacts will be cleared.

member.summary: Encapsulates methods to format number, currency and date.

member.summary: Gets the collection of supported request types by this handler.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.FormattingService.FormatCurrency(Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.Messages.GetFormattedCurrencyServiceRequest)
member.summary: Formats the currency.
member.returns: A GetFormattedContentServiceResponse object containing the formatted value.
member.remarks: This method formats the currency according to the culture info which is determined by the channel locale or company language. The currency symbol contained in the request has nothing to do with the format, but it will be put into the formatted value. e.g. [$, 123.46] (en-US) -> $123.46. [€, 123.46] (fr-FR) -> 123,46 €. [$, 123.46] (fr-FR) -> 123,46 $.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.InventoryAvailabilityServiceDataRetriever
member.summary: The purpose of this class is to operate as a level of abstraction for InventoryAvailabilityService to retrieve Inventory Availability data. Logic in this class will decide whether requests query from the Cache or the database.
member.remarks:
Feature Overview: When the Product Availability Job runs in the HQ, we write "The most recent RecId from InventTrans?" to RetailInventAvailabilityParameters. This is referred to as LastInventoryTransactionId. For now, these API's only consider PendingSalesOrder transactions, as these are orders created from an Online channel. When these orders are created into Sales Orders in HQ with the Order Synchronizer, we create an entry for the transaction in RetailTransactionOrderStatus. The RetailTransacionOrderStatus entry tracks the smallest InventTrans RecId created on the order. Therefore, we are able to check if a transaction was included in our [Order Synchronizer + Product Availability Job + 1130 sync] by checking if the transaction is a part of an Order Status entry, and if this Order Status entry has a last invent trans less than or equal to our current LastInventoryTransactionId.
When requesting inventory data (from RetailProductWarehouseInventory) from cache, we will check what the LastInventoryTransactionId value was at the time of retrieving this data. We can then check if our cached inventory data is "In sync with the database" by only requesting the LastInventoryTransactionId from the database. We will cache the LastInvenTrans for a very short period (1 second) to rate limit our requests.
** Overview of algorithm ** 1) Get current LastInventoryTransactionId (this is cached for short period to rate limit this common request). 2) Request for inventory data: - If all availabilities found (and in sync with database) in cache: - Return them - Else (at least one availability not found): - Request for all availabilities from database - Write availabilities to cache 3) Request for quantity of products sold that have not been posted: - Foreach unposted quantity requested: - If in cache and in sync with database LastInventoryTransactionId: - If unposted quantity calculated in last minute; - Return as is - Else (found in cache, but not calculated in last minute): - Request unposted quantity SINCE LAST CALCULATION from database - ReCache this unposted quantity - Return this unposted quantity - Else (not found in cache, or found and out of sync with LastInventoryTransactionId): - Request unposted quantity from entire transaction history (we have a maximum backwards datetime to avoid potentially calculating over years of data). - Cache this unposted quantity - Return this unposted quantity 4) Combine the inventory data with its matching unposted quantity, and return.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.InventoryAvailabilityServiceDataRetriever.GetUnpostedOnlineQuantities(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.DataModel.ProductWarehouse},System.Int64,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the sum of transactions given the last inventory transaction. This value represents the sum of Pending Sales Order (Online) transactions that are not included in the inventory values in the RetailProductWarehouseInventory table.
member.remarks: Either: - Gets the sum of transactions in the database. - Finds the sum of transactions in cache that is up to date (current last invent trans) within the valid sum cache window. - Finds the sum of transactions in cache that is up to date (current last invent trans) and not within the valid sum cache window, so queries only for sum since last calc. - Gets queried for transactions that contain some range of the three scenarios above, and handles each appropriately.
member.param: The last inventory transaction to consider from while calculating the sum.
The number of summations found in cache within valid cache hit time.
member.returns: The sum of transactions given the last inventory transaction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.InventoryAvailabilityServiceDataRetriever.GetLastInventoryTransactionId
member.summary: Gets the last inventory transaction either from cache or from the database.
member.returns: The last inventory transaction at the time of our Product Availability job running.

member.summary: This method tries to receive all availabilities from Cache. If not all availabilities are found (valid) from cache, then we request all of them from the database. If new availability data has been synced (and our cache is out of date), it is okay to return "old" data as there is a short window of time this could happen. The situation we avoid is that A and B are requested, and we return A from (newly synced) database, and B from stale data.
member.param: The List to write our availabilities to.
member.returns: True if all availabilities are found, False otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.DummyFraudProtectionService
member.summary: A set of empty handlers to process Fraud Protection requests.
member.remarks: These empty handlers are needed to avoid problems with offline MPOS. The requests are invoked without any checks for the type of the channel (right now the integration supports Online Channel only) as well as whether the DFP integration is enabled or not. This dummy implementation which does not do anything but returning empty responses makes sure there are no regressions for those compositions where real Fraud Protection Service is not leveraged.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.GetyReadOnlyExemptionsRequestHandler
member.summary:
A handler that provides exemptions for the ReadOnlyAttribute.
This implementation will look at Commerce shared parameters for key/value configs like this: "RetailReadOnlyExempt_[EntityName]" : "[ColumnName1],[ColumnName2],..."
An exemption can be created for a specific role with a key/value config like this: "RetailReadOnlyExempt_[RoleName]_[EntityName]" : "[ColumnName1],[ColumnName2],..." Where "RoleName" is from .
For example, to exempt NetAmount and TaxAmount from the CartLineData entity for all roles, a config key/val would look like this: RetailReadOnlyExempt_CartLineData : NetAmount,TaxAmount
To make a similar exemption but only for POS users, the key/val would be: RetailReadOnlyExempt_Employee_CartLineData : NetAmount,TaxAmount

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.GetyReadOnlyExemptionsRequestHandler.Process(Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Framework.GetReadOnlyExemptionsRequest)
member.summary: Handles the request by returning the exemptions. This default implementation gives no exemptions -- the intention is for users to implement their own handler if they must make exemptions for ReadOnly.
member.param: The request to get the exemptions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.GetyReadOnlyExemptionsRequestHandler.GetExemptions(Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.RequestContext)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.ReceiptIndia.IndiaReceiptServiceHelper.PopulateTaxSummaryForIndia(Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.DataModel.SalesTransaction,Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.DataModel.TaxSummarySettingIndia)
member.summary: Populate tax summary for India.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.ReceiptIndia.IndiaReceiptServiceHelper.BuildIndiaTaxSummaryPerLine(Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.DataModel.SalesTransaction)
member.summary: Build tax summary lines of the India receipt, with tax amounts be aggregated by sale line items.
member.returns: The tax summary lines of the India receipt.
member.remarks:
In this case, the settings of "RetailStoreTable > Misc > Receipts" is as follows, 1) The "Tax details" option is set as "Per line" 2) The "Show tax on tax" option is set as "N/A", as it is disabled in this case For example, the retail transaction has four sale line items, as follows,
Item ID | Price | Tax code | Formula | Tax basis | Tax rate | Tax amount 0001 | 100 | SERV5 | Line amount | 100.00 | 5% | 5.00 | | E-CSS5 | Excl.+[SERV5] | 5.00 | 5% | 0.25 0002 | 100 | VAT10 | Line amount | 100.00 | 10% | 10.00 | | Surchg2 | Excl.+[VAT10] | 10.00 | 2% | 0.20 0003 | 100 | SERV4 | Line amount | 100.00 | 4% | 4.00 | | E-CSS5 | Excl.+[SERV4] | 4.00 | 5% | 0.20 0004 | 100 | VAT12 | Line amount | 100.00 | 12% | 12.00 | | Surchg2 | Excl.+[VAT12] | 12.00 | 2% | 0.24 And the tax summary lines will be as follows, Tax code | Tax basis | Tax rate | Tax amount AA | 100.00 | 5.25% | 5.25 AB | 100.00 | 10.20% | 10.20 AC | 100.00 | 4.20% | 4.20 AD | 100.00 | 12.24% | 12.24 Tax codes are automatically named from "AA" to "AZ", ...

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.ReceiptIndia.IndiaReceiptServiceHelper.BuildIndiaTaxSummaryPerComponentNotShowTaxonTax(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.DataModel.TaxLineIndia})
member.summary: Build tax summary line of the India receipt, with tax amounts be aggregated by "main" tax codes (which are not India tax on tax codes).
member.param: All tax items of the India retail transaction.
member.returns: The tax summary lines of the India receipt.
member.remarks:
In this case, the settings of >"RetailStoreTable > Misc. > Receipts" is as follows, 1) The "Tax details" option is set as "Per tax component" 2) The "Show tax on tax" option is turned OFF For example, the retail transaction has four sale line items, as follows,
Item ID | Price | Tax code | Formula | Tax basis | Tax rate | Tax amount 0001 | 100 | SERV5 | Line amount | 100.00 | 5% | 5.00 | | E-CSS5 | Excl.+[SERV5] | 5.00 | 5% | 0.25 0002 | 100 | VAT10 | Line amount | 100.00 | 10% | 10.00 | | Surchg2 | Excl.+[VAT10] | 10.00 | 2% | 0.20 0003 | 100 | SERV4 | Line amount | 100.00 | 4% | 4.00 | | E-CSS5 | Excl.+[SERV4] | 4.00 | 5% | 0.20 0004 | 100 | VAT12 | Line amount | 100.00 | 12% | 12.00 | | Surchg2 | Excl.+[VAT12] | 12.00 | 2% | 0.24 And the tax summary lines will be as follows, Tax code | Tax basis | Tax rate | Tax amount SERV5 | 100.00 | 5.25% | 5.25 SERV4 | 100.00 | 4.20% | 4.20 VAT10 | 100.00 | 10.20% | 10.20 VAT12 | 100.00 | 12.24% | 12.24.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.ReceiptIndia.IndiaReceiptServiceHelper.BuildIndiaTaxSummaryPerComponentShowTaxonTax(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.DataModel.TaxLineIndia})
member.summary: Build tax summary line of the India receipt, with tax amounts be aggregated by tax codes.
member.param: All tax items of the India retail transaction.
member.returns: The tax summary lines of the India receipt.
member.remarks:
In this case, the settings of "RetailStoreTable > Misc. > Receipts" is as follows, 1) The "Tax details" option is set as "Per tax component" 2) The "Show tax on tax" option is turned ON For example, the retail transaction has four sale line items, as follows,
Item ID | Price | Tax code | Formula | Tax basis | Tax rate | Tax amount 0001 | 100 | SERV5 | Line amount | 100.00 | 5% | 5.00 | | E-CSS5 | Excl.+[SERV5] | 5.00 | 5% | 0.25 0002 | 100 | VAT10 | Line amount | 100.00 | 10% | 10.00 | | Surchg2 | Excl.+[VAT10] | 10.00 | 2% | 0.20 0003 | 100 | SERV4 | Line amount | 100.00 | 4% | 4.00 | | E-CSS5 | Excl.+[SERV4] | 4.00 | 5% | 0.20 0004 | 100 | VAT12 | Line amount | 100.00 | 12% | 12.00 | | Surchg2 | Excl.+[VAT12] | 12.00 | 2% | 0.24 And the tax summary lines will be as follows, Tax component | Tax code | Tax basis | Tax rate | Tax amount Service | SERV5 | 100.00 | 5% | 5.00 Service | SERV4 | 100.00 | 4% | 4.00 E-CSS | E-CSS5 | 9.00 | 5% | 0.45 VAT | VAT10 | 100.00 | 10% | 10.00 VAT | VAT12 | 100.00 | 12% | 12.00 Surcharge | Surchg2 | 22.00 | 2% | 0.44.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.ReceiptService.GetAlignmentSettings(System.String,Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.DataModel.ReceiptItemInfo)
member.summary: Align the value on receipt.
member.remarks:
The value to be aligned has following three cases: 1. valueToBeAligned = "Youth Accessory Combo Set" -- the value does not have new line marker, just trim and align it accordingly. 2. valueToBeAligned = "
" or "" -- treat it as an empty string. 3. valueToBeAligned = "636 140TH CT
Apt C200
WA, 98007" -- the value has multiple lines, we need to trim and align each line.

member.summary: The default rounding value

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.Rounding.RoundToUnit(System.Decimal,System.Decimal,Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.DataModel.RoundingMethod)
member.summary: Rounds values to nearest currency unit, i.e 16,45 kr. rounded up if the smallest coin is 10 kr will give 20 kr. or if the smallest coin is 24 aurar(0,25 kr.) then if rounded up it will give 16,50 kr.
member.param: The currency value or value to be rounded.
The smallest unit to be rounded to.
The method of rounding (i.e. nearest, up or down).
member.returns: Returns a value rounded to the nearest unit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Commerce.Runtime.Services.RoundingService.NumberFormat(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Returns a string to give the correct number number of decimals depending on the currency unit. 1 will give return N0, 0,1 returns N1, 0,01 returns N2 etc.
member.returns: Returns the format string N0,N1, etc for the ToString function.

member.summary: Applies the given tax intervals to the basis and returns the net result.
member.param: The tax intervals to apply to the basis, in order from lowest TaxLimitMin to highest.
The basis that will be taxed based on the tax intervals.
member.returns: The net amount to be taxed on the basis, determined by the given intervals.
member.remarks: The calculationIntervals parameter is expected to follow the rules for tax intervals set by AX: - The first interval must have a Minimum limit of zero. - The last interval must have a Maximum limit of zero, which indicates infinity. - The Maximum limit of an interval must be the Minimum limit of the next interval.
